hypothesis_content.title: Gas Spike as Altcoin (SOL, AVAX) Mean Reversion Catalyst
hypothesis_content.statement: A sharp, unsustained spike in Ethereum gas price (7-day z-score > 2.5) will act as a short-term negative catalyst for ETH/BTC ratio and a positive catalyst for competing L1 tokens (SOL, AVAX) relative to BTC over the following 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: High Ethereum gas fees highlight network drawbacks, prompting short-term capital rotation into perceived 'Ethereum competitor' Layer 1s. This is a narrative-driven, mean-reverting flow within a neutral regime.
entry_conditions: ETH 7-day Avg Gas z-score crosses above 2.5 (calculated over 90-day lookback)
ETH/BTC ratio 4h RSI(14) > 60 (showing recent relative strength)

exit_conditions.take_profit: SOL/BTC or AVAX/BTC ratio increases by 3% from entry OR ETH/BTC ratio decreases by 2% from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: ETH/BTC ratio makes a new 5-day high

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The median 5-day return for SOL/BTC or AVAX/BTC following the gas z-score trigger is not statistically significantly greater than zero (p > 0.1).
